page.title: 15The Cheshire Home
page.content: { The Cheshire home}was opened in 1972.The Cheshire home was built for physically disabled people. There are 13 residents and they each have their own bedsits.There are 22 staff in the Cheshire home.{Leonard Cheshire thought of opening the Cheshire homes There are about 100 Cheshire homes in britain.Before the Cheshire home was a Cheshire home it was a house, and a very rich man owned it.They like playing, bingo, cards, scrabble, noughts and crosses.They like watching television. The youngest resident in the Cheshire home is 17. They go on holidays to Spain and Switzerland. The staff come from Shanklin, Ventnor and East Cowes. The residents are all in wheelchairs except one.The Home is in Rylestone Gardens near Appley steps.
